abstract.text: The CLEO-c Experiment has made several recent contributions to the study of charmonium decays.
This review briefly outlines the CLEO-c analyses of charmonium that were completed or made public during 2010.
Special attention is given to the discovery of the process e + e − → π + π − hc at a center of mass energy of 4170 MeV.

body_text.text: Introduction

Despite the conclusion of data-taking in 2008, the CLEO-c Experiment -which utilizes symmetric e + e − collisions in the charmonium region provided by the Cornell Electron Storage Ring (CESR) -continues to have an active program in the analysis of charmonium data.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Recent CLEO-c studies include: (1) measurements of the branching fractions of χ cJ → ppπ 0 , ppη, and ppω 1 ; (2) studies of ψ(2S) decays to γpp, ppπ 0 , and ppη and a confirmation of the BESII observation of the X(1870), a pp threshold enhancement in J/ψ → γpp 2 ; (3) a search for the radiative transition ψ(2S) → γη c (2S) 3 ; (4) measurements of the higher order multipoles in the radiative transitions ψ(2S) → γχ c1,2 and χ c1,2 → γJ/ψ 4 ; and (5) the discovery of the process e + e − → π + π − h c at a center of mass energy of 4170 MeV (preliminary).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In the following, each study is briefly reviewed.

body_text.text: In addition to the χ cJ decays discussed above, CLEO-c has also measured the branching fractions of ψ(2S) decays to final states involving a pp pair 2 .

body_text.text: Higher-order Multipole Amplitudes in Charmonium Radiative Transitions

The radiative decays ψ(2S) → γχ c1,2 and χ c1,2 → γJ/ψ are dominated by electric dipole (E1) amplitudes, but are expected to have small additional contributions from the higher-order magnetic quadrupole (M2) amplitudes.
body_text.section: Higher-order Multipole Amplitudes in Charmonium Radiative Transitions

body_text.text: The relative contributions of the M2 amplitudes are, at least in principle, sensitive to the anomalous magnetic moment of the charm quark.
body_text.section: Higher-order Multipole Amplitudes in Charmonium Radiative Transitions

body_text.text: CLEO performed a high-statistics analysis of this process using the decay chains ψ(2S) → γχ cJ ; χ cJ → γJ/ψ; J/ψ → l + l − (l = e, µ) for J = 1, 2, using clean samples of approximately 40 000 events for J = 1 and approximately 20 000 events for J = 2 4 , significantly larger event samples than previous measurements.

body_text.text: Transitions to the h c Above DD Threshold
Finally, CLEO-c has presented preliminary results on the observation of e + e − → π + π − h c at a center of mass energy of 4170 MeV.
body_text.section: Transitions to the h c Above DD Threshold

body_text.text: This builds upon a previous analysis of CLEO-c to study the e + e − → XJ/ψ (X = π + π − , π 0 π 0 , K + K − , etc.) cross sections as a function of center of mass energy 7 .
body_text.section: Transitions to the h c Above DD Threshold

body_text.text: In that analysis a rise in the cross section at 4260 MeV for both the π + π − J/ψ and π 0 π 0 J/ψ reactions was attributed to the Y (4260), a charmonium hybrid meson candidate first discovered by BaBar 8 .
body_text.section: Transitions to the h c Above DD Threshold

body_text.text: Since that analysis, CLEO-c has collected a total of 586 pb −1 of data at 4170 MeV, about twenty times larger than the data sets used to search for XJ/ψ between 4120 and 4200 MeV.
body_text.section: Transitions to the h c Above DD Threshold

body_text.text: Using this larger data set, CLEO-c has made the first observation of e + e − → π + π − h c at 4170 MeV and has searched for e + e − → π + π − h c in the original scan data, which spans energies from 3970 to 4260 MeV.
